comments.commentBody: I like this puzzle so much I am adding a comment. First the theme is as clean as it is clever. Two word phrases are cleverly and amusingly changed in their meanings with not so strained cluing. And no revealer is needed to understand it. The fill is superb. All the four letter entries are common words. The only exception is ETTE and, when ETTE is the worst entry in a puzzle, it is great construction. And the three letter entries are all legitimate and not strained. That is a lot to ask for a Tuesday puzzle and Ms. Lempel delivers.

Jeff,
I lived in America in the late 20th and early 21 century. It is still great to be middle class in America. Your characterization of Hillary Clinton is right on but Il lived in all of Chicago. I grew up in Montreal where I became used to living and being everywhere in the city. In Montreal I was used to exploring poor White and Black neighbourhoods. I was comfortable in Chinatown, and the wealthiest French Canadian enclave. Today Montreal is integrated, its population is mostly ethnic and you can find Jamaican restaurants next door the East Indian and Thai eateries and find the same people in all the restaurants.
When I go to your Chicago or Hillary and Bill enclaves all I can think about is the old Phil Ochs song, Love me I'm a Liberal. I think of high schools only a couple of miles apart where one has a campus of broken asphalt and one has a theatre program worthy of the most generously endowed liberal arts college.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u52Oz-54VYw
Quebec had its quiet revolution in the 1970s. Do you expect America's underclass to wait 200 years till they have their own Irish Potato Starvation.
It is over 50 years since Kennedy was murdered and things have not improved for far too many. It was only 25 years after Quebec's revolution when suddenly your doctors lawyers and business executives did not all come from fine middle class backgrounds.

Odd. I go from reading Bill Clinton as he opines that some unknown, sinister group of young men (aka The Bro's) have been speaking ill of his wife - even going so far as to use the word "profane" in describing the dreadful crimes committed by these internet hooligan's - then return to a novel about Kit Marlowe being interrogated by the Bishop for possibly associating with a 'bad' group who have questioned the faith and displeased the Queen. In the 16th century. In 2016, the accusation is misogyny. In Elizabethan England, it was "atheism". In both instances, the point was to throw the mud and protect those in power. Are we truly to believe that some hot-headed crack by an over-excited 19 year old presents a threat to the former Secretary  of State? (Or that a poet in the 1590's was going to take down Christendom) Nonsense in both instances. You want misogyny, Bill? Try Walmart. Your wife was the director, you might recall.
I am sorry but these posts are hilarious! So much drama  Hamlet! floodgates! soiling! Clintons in full force! Oh Lawzy. This is really really funny. Thank you.

When people attack the person, it is because they have no issues upon which to stand.

I respect Senator Sanders and Secretary of State Clinton. My vote does not have anything to do with personalities.

My vote is for the better qualified candidate who has the better chance of winning the general election. That person is HRC in my estimation.

People who call themselves Sanders supporters have launched a series of attacks against Mrs. Clinton and her husband. You did.

In fact, the attacks are so vicious and misogynistic in some cases that I have to believe they are from Republicans posing as Sanders supporters.

Senator Sanders runs on issues, so it is tough to reconcile that with the hate speech from some corners of his supporters.
She is helpful to all woman unless they spoke up against the sexual misconduct of her husband or happen to like Bernie Sanders.

So if Hillary is all about female empowerment, why did she need her husband to deliver a not-so-artful smear against the most honest candidate in either party?  If Bill acted alone, then we are still waiting for her public rejection of his speech, as it was intended to benefit her.

If you are against Bernie you are a misandrist.

Sorry was channeling Hillary and her surrogates there.
Thank you, Kay!

The desperate cries of an emasculated has-been . . . both pitiful and repulsive.

Hillary is warm bread on her way to becoming toast once again. Bill is desperate to be remembered as the CinC's significant other, not for his performance in that position.

Forget it, Bill. Our lasting memory will be your inviting impeachment for momentary sensual satisfaction. Was it really that good?
That made me laugh out loud.

I recommend you to read the recent issue of TIME, interviewed by Joe Klein, an early supporter of Bill Clinton. "Do you see her now?" Some quotes for you:

She once was the sort of peron who would vote for Sanders in the primary;in fact, her Bernie-Geroge McGovern.

Dear Matt: If you think "there is no slander coming out of the Sanders campaign" then you are either naive or misinformed. The propaganda from "others" who claim to be independent supporters of Bernie, not a PAC per se just "concerned voters" have flooded this and other publications with articles highlighting potential indiscretions in Hillary's Super PACs, and though not actually having proof of any wrongdoing, much like the Benghazi Affair and the e-mail "Scandal", but through innuendo and insinuation they imbibe us with a deep implication that something is rotten in Denmark, an expression I should inform any young readers out there who read more than a 100 or so characters that in no way is this an affront to Denmark. It's a saying as old as the hills, older than even Bernie.

Have a good night, and please do vote in our primary in April. By then Bernie will need all the help he can muster.
Like first of all, since he is not a registered Democrat, getting on the ballot.

DD
Manhattan

Ms. Steinem and Secretary Albright are certainly entitled to endorse a candidate.

They can even tell you why it matters that Secretary Clinton is a woman, because she has to be that much more qualified to win. Palin wasn't more qualified and didn't win.

You don't have to vote for HRC, and you don't have to follow the advice of other women mavericks like Steinem and Albright.

But some people do care about what they think. I do.

So take a nap if your tired, or turn the channel, but in an election people will speak their minds just like you did.
Actually have you seen the ad? It is very misleading. And you can still find it online. Watch it before you comment-- http://www.politifact.com/new-hampshire/statements/2016/feb/04/bernie-s/...

Bill " was " a good man. Created a number of jobs and stock market rally during his tenure. In the last 3 years he has become just another " corrupt" influence peddler. Please review the public 2013 and 2014 joint 1040 tax returns of the Clintons which are public. Bubba has made $4MM + a year as a fake educational consultant " emertisi" to the former Sylvan Learning ( which he had to resign from) and some odd Educational University aligned with the UAE or the Emeritus. In add-on his former support staff persons corrupt consulting company has given Bubba $5MM per year. Its not the books. Its the consulting and ridiculous $7-$10MM of speaking fees offset with $2MM of leased plane fees. Ironically their return did deduct a home office use ( haha) and IT services. What a bunch of corrupt money grubbers. Get off the stage. Bill and Hillary do not seem to be in robust heath as well reeling on Humma. They run the money losing $2BB Clinton Foundation with over $200MM of annual income at  staggering loss employing their own employees , not usual. Go way. The only reason HC is running for President is the final of about 10 coverups- The Clinton Foundation will run out of donors if she loses and fold. Absolute Hypocrisy . Do you want to trust all those facts to Trump?

Really?
This, from our former President who "respected" women issues within the oval office, advocated for and implemented what was perhaps the most draconian anti women's welfare bill to pass within any presidential term.
Consider the source and follow the Clinton/Goldman money trail to the truth of the matter.

That's what I have been wondering. It is a terrible job, and the only reason I can see for applying for it is that a person has an over-arching belief in actions that will benefit the nation, and a passion for the good of the country.

I don't hear that from Hillary at all.

Bernie articulates it well, I think of him as inner-directed. His has the strength of his convictions, and his convictions have resonant appeal. Hillary appears to be other directed with herself at centre stage, and no true convictions or vision.

Now here is Bill Clinton who signed NAFTA and the legislation to get rid of Glass-Steagall which contributed to the Great Recession among other things criticizing Bernie Sanders for being dishonest, inaccurate, sexist, and hypocritical. He has absolutely no room to talk.

Keep it up Bill, I will not defend you as I did in the past. You and Hillary forgot about the "little people."
I can see it again the two of you are the victims of a vast progressive conspiracy!
niglea, well how is he going to do that if he is so busy writing stuff like this.  lol.
Very good point, thank you.

I think you overpriced the assessment at 2 cents.

You would not persuade any Clinton supporter to the contrary.

If anything, you underscore what the Clintons have been fighting for decades. Smears and lies.

When you can discuss policy positions without smears, you might have the credibility to change minds.

On the contrary, you just confirmed my support of Secretary Clinton.

While the market basket story is awesome, they way you use it shows your ignorance. If the president could truly lead a revolution wouldn't Obama have realized more of that hope and changed he promised? He admitted in his final state of the union that the country is now more divided than when he started. The unfortunate job of president in today's political reality is not about rising up against the man but negotiating, deal making, horse trading, and making consistent incremental improvements. Obama did make advancements and much more work needs to be done but the fantasy of the people rising up when we have a deeply divided country is incredibly naive. Do you think the Trump supporters are going to join the Bernie bandwagon?

And the more you learn, the worse it gets:
Tyson's Green Forest plant let chicken waste contaminate the water in May 1983 (guess who was governor). 15 months later gov. Clinton declared the town a disaster area. This happened after a 1977 agreement with Tyson that the state never enforced.

The Times also reported, “During Mr. Clinton's tenure in Arkansas, Tyson benefited from a variety of state actions, including $9 million in government loans, the placement of company executives on important state boards and favorable decisions on environmental issues.”
NY Times March 1994

http://www.nytimes.com/1994/03/18/us/top-arkansas-lawyer-helped-hillary-...
